Author: 차미숙#8912
Content: Overall, i used it first time today and it looks great

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: The txt file download is my only complain

Author: 차미숙#8912
Content: I heard they take 0.5% of claims or something?

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: It's a great wallet

Author: 차미숙#8912
Content: I can pay that

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: No they don't

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: That was the atomic labs tool which was 5% for rewards.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: But that's free now too

Author: 차미숙#8912
Content: I wouldn't mind paying like a tiny bit since devs gotta pay their bills and stuff

Author: 차미숙#8912
Content: Or they won't upgrade and abandon it

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Yeah, it does make sense

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: That's something we should think about for Chameleon Pay

Author: 차미숙#8912
Content: Yeah just make sure to integrate to ledger

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: We are looking now at adding ledger on mobile but I'm not sure how many people actually use ledger on mobile yet

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: It requires a special cable

Author: 차미숙#8912
Content: More easy wallets are what kmd needs right now

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Have you seen Chameleon for mobile?

Author: 차미숙#8912
Content: And those wallets need some cash flow to keep them sustainable

Author: 차미숙#8912
Content: No not yet

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Check it out and let me know what you think

Author: 차미숙#8912
Content: But i want my funds to stay at ledger

Author: 차미숙#8912
Content: So a bridge is what i need

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Oh yeah I agree.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Hot wallets should be for spending funds. Not storing alot of funds unless it has hardware wallet support.

Author: 차미숙#8912
Content: Well it would be nice if online wallets can act as a bridge btw dex and ledger

Author: 차미숙#8912
Content: So the funds stay at ledger after the transaction

Author: 차미숙#8912
Content: And hot wallets can take fee in the middle

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Binance DEX already had that capability

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Probably a matter of time until it's adopted more widely

Author: 차미숙#8912
Content: Binance dex has regulation limit though

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Trust wallet for example let's you trade from ledger

Author: 차미숙#8912
Content: Like countries and KYC

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Well, any wallet provider has to abide by regulation

Author: 차미숙#8912
Content: Well the wallet can act as a bridge since it is not a dex itself

Author: 차미숙#8912
Content: Can it not bypass regulation?

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: Nope

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: It could probably fly under the radar for some time but it can land the company that owns it in big trouble. You could possibly create a open source app that isn't in appstores that could be more censor resistant.

Author: PTYX#6840
Content: But you would need to sideload the app manually and most people don't want to do that.

Content: what is your address and when did you file a claim?

Author: Tjohnson#5310
Content: "what is your address and when did you file a claim?" presuming this is directed to me... my new public address is RHWS3fcmQ3r8ZAPTwoNc8mBpwPAkWayQEB     Best guess on the claim date is around 6/16

Content: your claim shows a different old address

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so the processor couldnt process it

Content: @Tjohnson what is your old address from where the funds were swept?

Author: Tjohnson#5310
Content: looking

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i updated the claims data

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: ok. thanks

Author: Tjohnson#5310
Content: do I still need to look?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you seem to have claimed an unused address as old address so it didnt match up

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no need, it will get processed tomorrow. i am running maintenance on the refund server today

Author: Tjohnson#5310
Content: So there's nothing I need to do?  Great Thanks alot for you prompt response; much appreciated
